hypothesis_content.title: Momentum Exhaustion Signal at Key VWAP Deviation
hypothesis_content.statement: In a trending BULL or BEAR regime, when BTC price deviates by more than 3.5% from its 12-hour Volume-Weighted Average Price (VWAP) on a 1-hour closing basis, and the 1-hour RSI(14) simultaneously exceeds 70 (in uptrend) or falls below 30 (in downtrend), a high-probability short-term reversion to the 12-hour VWAP begins within the next 2-3 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In a strong trend, large deviations from the volume-weighted average price represent over-extension. Combined with hourly RSI extremes, this indicates short-term momentum exhaustion. Algorithmic traders and profit-takers use VWAP as a key benchmark, creating collective selling (in uptrends) or buying (in downtrends) pressure at these extremes.
entry_conditions: Regime is BULL (for short signal) or BEAR (for long signal) with confidence > 65%
1h RSI(14) > 70 in BULL regime OR < 30 in BEAR regime
Deviation occurs after at least 4 consecutive 1-hour closes in the trending direction

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to within 0.5% of the 12h VWAP
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price extends deviation by an additional 1.5%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The mean reversion to within 1% of VWAP does not occur within 8 hours for >50% of signals, or the average loss on stop-outs exceeds the average gain on take-profits.
